noun.description: Electricity. A device producing an electromotive force, a voltaic cell; (also) a metal serving as one of the poles or elements of such a cell. Now historical.
A machine for applying electricity as a motive power; an electric motor.

adjective.description: Electricity and Biology. Involving or producing an electromotive force.

origin: Early 19th century. From electro- + motor, after French électromoteur.
